module.name: organization_structure
module.keywords: module, systems engineering, organization, project management

abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of information that provides relationships, functional roles, skill qualification and documentation.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of information that provides relationships, functional roles, skill qualification and documentation.

Systems Engineering encompasses the design and specification of systems, and the planning and management of the engineering processes that design, manufacture, field, and support that system. This module captures information concerning organizations and persons associated with those organizations along with useful relationships to location and qualifications. That information is needed to manage the life cycle process of developing and using a system such that qualified persons and organizations can be assigned to projects.
This AP233 module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules, The associated rational for inclusion follows:
The Organization Type Module captures the definition of types of organizations that project management deals with.

The Person Organization Module captures definitions of a person and an organization with related information. It captures the definition of a relationship between two organizations and the identification of a person in the context of an organization. It captures the definition of an address for persons or organizations, and the assignment of an address to a person in an organization or to an organization.
The Certification Module captures any type of person or organization certification relevant to the project management.
The Experience Module captures the kinds of experience that is relevant to a project. It associates experience with persons and organizations.

The Location Module captures the location of products, resources, and activities for the purpose of managing projects. The location information may be geographic, postal information, or based on codes or zones. The locations may refer to other locations.

The Location Assignment Module captures the association of location with a product, event, activity, or person for the purpose of managing projects. It captures the vapd use of an association of a location with organization, organization type, position, position-type, type of person, and person in organization.
The Person Organization Assignment Module captures the associations of an organization with activity or product data and the association of a person in an organization with activity or product data.

The Position In Organization Module captures the definition of a position in an organization and the definition of types of positions. It captures the several relationships among positions and organizations.

The Quapfication Module provides the information needed by management to match persons and organizations to projects based on the skills needed for tasks, and the quapfications of the people/organizations. It captures the identification of quapfications and the association of quapfications with a person or an organization.

The Type of Person Module captures the definition of a type of person and the relationships between definitions of a type of person. It captures the association of a type of person in a role with an activity or product data, the classification of types of person, and the specification of required attributes for a type of person including quapfications and experience. It does not capture information relating to an individual person.
